title: Federal Government of Germany - Wikipedia
snippet: The current and 25th federal government of Germany has been in office since 6 May 2025, the day Friedrich Merz was elected Chancellor by the members of the 21st German Bundestag.

title: Website of the Federal Government | Bundesregierung
snippet: The current Federal Government consists of Federal Chancellor Friedrich Merz and 17 Federal Ministers. Together, they constitute the Federal Cabinet.

title: Federal Cabinet – Federal Government
snippet: The current Federal Government consists of Federal Chancellor Friedrich Merz and 17 Federal Ministers. Together, they constitute the Federal Cabinet.

title: Politics of Germany - Wikipedia
snippet: The office is currently held by Frank-Walter Steinmeier (since 2017). The federal president does have a role in the political system, especially at the establishment of a new government and the dissolution of the Bundestag (parliament).
